member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.RenderingType
member.summary: Type of rendering logic that is used to create rounded corners around button.

remarks.p:
Warnings:
If FileImages is used (which is automatically enabled with all defaults), then the InternetExplorer6 may fail to load background images and button becomes transparent. That problem can not be fixed by WebImageButton.
If BordersByTableCells is used and a particular browser fails to create a TD-html-element with the size of 1x1 pixels, then borders of button can be distorted and have increased width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.MaxWidth
member.summary: Maximum allowed width of control.
member.remarks: That property has effect only if ImageFiles is used and the Width of control in set in %. It prevents breaking background image on separate parts when width of control becomes too large.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum allowed height of control.
member.remarks: That property has effect only if ImageFiles is used and Height of control in set in %. It prevents breaking background image on separate parts when height of control becomes too large.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.WidthOfRightEdge
member.summary: Width of rectangle on the right side of control that is used to render right edge of background image.
member.remarks:
The larger radius of edges of background image, the larger value of that property should be.
That area can not contain text or image, so it is similar to the right-padding.
If that property is set to 0, then the width of control is defined by the value of MaxWidth property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.HeightOfBottomEdge
member.summary: Height of rectangle on the bottom side of control that is used to render bottom edge of background image.
member.remarks:
The larger radius of edges of background image, the larger value of that property should be.
That area can not contain text or image, so, it is similar to the bottom-padding.
If that property is set to 0, then the height of control is defined by the value of MaxHeight property.

member.remarks: That property has effect only when RenderingType is set to the FileImages (background images are used).

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of names for event function handlers used by JavaScript on client side.
member.remarks:
Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in returning information from the server, WebMenu implements both client-side events and server-side events. You can choose whether you would like to respond to client-side events, which must be implemented through JavaScript. The ClientSideEvents object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.
Every event function handler should have 3 parameters (the InitializeCalendar has only 1 parameter). The first parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents UltraWebTab.
The second parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Tab.
The third parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Event.
Look at the events description for details.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.Initialize
member.summary: Event fired after WebTextEdit was initialized.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client script may contain 2 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains instant text that appears in editor

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.ValueChange
member.summary: Event fired when control loses the input focus the value was modified.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client script may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains reference to the old value (value before change)
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
This event can be canceled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.TextChanged
member.summary: Event fired when the text was modified by user.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client script may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains new text in editor
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.InvalidValue
member.summary: Event fired when the control loses the input focus and has invalid value.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client script may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains object that is different for every particular editor. In case of WebDateTimeEditor it is the reference to the object that contains instant values of date fields, suggested date, and type of invalid event.
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
If that event was canceled by the oEvent.cancel=true;, then the Server is not notified about invalid value.
In case of WebDateTime editor, if the value if the fields.date was modified, then that suggested value is used automatically.

Invalid string which could not be converted to a valid value.
In case of WebNumericEdit it is fired when following strings were entered: ".", "-.", "-".
In case of WebDateTimeEdit, the last good date value was used as the new value.

member.summary: Entered value was beyond minimum or maximum limits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.InvalidValueType.FieldValue
member.summary:
Wrong values of fields, missing field value, etc.
In case of WebNumericEdit it is fired when empty string was entered and null value was not allowed. In case of WebDateTimeEdit it is fired when some date fields had invalid values, but new-suggested value was constructed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.DefaultTriangleImages
member.summary: Size of default triangle images.

remarks.p: If ImageUrl property of a button is set, then default triangle images for that button are not displayed.
Color of image for a particular state of button is defined by the ForeColor of "Style" properties located in the ButtonsAppearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Display
member.summary: Visibility and layout of spin buttons.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Delay
member.summary: Initial delay in milliseconds between increment/decrement spin events.

remarks.p: Default value is set to 200.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Delta
member.summary: Value that is used to increment/decrement editing value on spin events.

remarks.p: That value is also used when increment/decrement happens on the up/down arrow keys.
In case of zero, the value of 1 of the field where caret was is used.
Default value is set to 1. In case of date editor, it is 1 day and in case of time editor it is 1 minute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpeedUpRate
member.summary: Ability to automatically increase/decrease delay while spin events.

remarks.p:
This property allows to increase, decrease or keep permanent delay between spin events.
Positive values will gradually decrease delay (increase speed) until the value of the (Delay / 2 ^ value) is reached.
Negative values will increase delay (decrease speed) until the value of the (Delay * 2 ^ value) is reached.
Value of zero will keep permanent delay between spin events.
Range of values is -3..0..+6. The value of -3 will slow down initial delay in 8 times. The value of 6 will speed up initial delay in 64 times.
Default value is set to 3.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnArrowKeys
member.summary:
Ability to increment/decrement value on Up/Down arrow keys.
Default value is set to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnReadOnly
member.summary: Ability to increment/decrement value when ReadOnly is true.

remarks.p: Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnlyOneField
member.summary: Ability to increment/decrement value of only one field.

remarks.p:
This property is applied only to date editor.
If value is true, then only one current field is incremented/decremented and all other fieds remain unchanged.
If value is false, then other date fields can be affected too.
Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.EnsureFocus
member.summary: Ability to ensure input focus while spin events.

remarks.p: If that property is false and a spin-button is pressed, then value is incremented/decremented, though, focus remains at the control which had input focus before a spin-button was pressed.
Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Width
member.summary: Width of spin buttons excluding borders.

remarks.p: If button has image, then width can not be smaller than the width of image.
If value is not set, then 12 pixel is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.UseBrowserDefaults
member.summary: This property allows to automatically adjust appearance related properties to match with appearance of edit-field and drop-down button elements used by a particular browser on the client.

remarks.p: Default value is true.

Note: If any appearance related property is set, then those values are not affected and they have priority over corresponding "automatic" defaults.
At the time the WebTextEdit supports only 3 types of predifined styles:
Internet Explorer under Windows2000.
Netscape Navigator regardless of platform.
Internet Explorer (blue) under WindowsXP.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.AllowAltPlusDigits
member.summary: Determines whether the user can enter characters by using the ALT key + numeric keypad digits method.

remarks.p: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.HideEnterKey
member.summary: Hides the Enter key.

remarks.p: Setting this property to true disables the default response of the browser to an Enter key press.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum length of text string that can be entered in control.

remarks.p: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.PasswordMode
member.summary: Displays password-characters instead of actual text.

remarks.p: Setting this property to true creates input with type=password and browser defines how text string is displayed.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.Value
member.summary: Value in control.

remarks.p: In the WebTextEdit control, this property is simply a wrapper for the property.

This virtual property is overriden by every extended class. The type of value (structure in case of string) depends on the value of property. For example, in case of WebDateTimeEdit, Value can be DateTime, focus string or no-focus string.

The WebNumericEdit uses the properties of the NumberFormatInfo that starts with the "Number", for example, NumberDecimalDigits. The WebCurrencyEdit uses the properties of the NumberFormatInfo that starts with the "Currency", for example, CurrencyDecimalDigits.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.EditModeFormat
member.summary: Format of date used for edit mode when control has input focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the "d". If string has length of 1 (single flag-character such as: d, f, g, s, etc.), then the is used to obtain date pattern. Otherwise, this property is treated as explicit date pattern.
Example of explicit pattern: "dd-MM-yyyy" To learn about format flags and patterns, see documentation for the class.
Note The "z" and "g" characters and "%c" style in pattern are ignored. Possible day of the week field is ignored, and abbriviated month name is converted to digit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.DisplayModeFormat
member.summary: Format of date used for display mode when control has no input focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the empty string. If the string is empty, then the value of is used. If the string has a length of 1 (single flag-character such as: d, f, g, s, etc.), then the is used to obtain date pattern. Otherwise, this property is treated as explicit date pattern.
Example of an explicit pattern: "dd-MM-yyyy" To learn about format flags and patterns, see documentation for the class.
Note The "z" and "g" characters and "%c" style in pattern are ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.MinimumNumberOfValidFields
member.summary: Minimum number of valid fields in the date string which must be present to consider the date valid.

remarks.p: Range of values: 0-7. If this property is set to 0, all fields are validated. Default value is 3.

Missing hour, minute, second, millisecond fields are replaced by 0, and missing year, month, day fields are replaced by the fields of the today date. Date fields are counted from the left to right as they appear in the pattern of date format.

When validating, the day-of-week and AM-PM fields are skipped and not included for the purposes of this property. For example, if the pattern of date format is "M-d-yy H:mm:ss" and the MinimumNumberOfValidFields is 4, the following then strings are validated as indicated:

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.YearToFillCentury
member.summary: Value that is used to autofill year field to the 20th or 21st century if only 1 or 2 digits are entered.

remarks.p: Range of values: from -1 to 99.
If value is set to -1, then autofill is disabled.
If entered year is less or equal to the value of that property, then 2000 is added to the year field.
If entered year is larger than the value of that property and less than 100, then 1900 is added to the year field.
Default value is 29.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.InputMask
member.summary: Input mask used to filter keyboard entries.

remarks.p: Default value is set to "CCCCCCCCCCCC".

The mask may contain literal characters and input-mask-flags such as
& - any keyboard character (entry is required)
L - letter (entry is required)
0, # - digit (entry is required)
A - letter or digit (entry is required)
C - any keyboard character (entry is optional)
? - letter (entry is optional)
9 - digit (entry is optional)
a - letter or digit (entry is optional)
> - all letters to the right are converted to the upper case
< - all letters to the right are converted to the lower case
For more complete information on data masking, see the topic Data Masking Overview.

Notes:
If in front of any flag-character appears the "\" (escape) character, then that character becomes the literal part of mask. For example, if mask is set to the "A\A\BB\\##\99" and control has no data, then text in edit mode will appear as "_A\BB\#_9_". Where the "_" are available positions for entry.
To cancel upper/lower case convertion which was set by the > or < flag, that flag should be used one more time. For example, if mask is set to the ">CC->CC->CC" and user entered the "XxXxXx", then resulting text should appear as "XX-Xx-XX".
While control has no input focus, the optional empty mask positions are not displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.PadChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill required empty mask positions in the display text while the control does not have focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the Space character.
While control has no input focus, the optional empty mask positions are not displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.PromptChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill empty mask positions in the display text while the control has focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the '_' (underscore) character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.EmptyPositionChar
member.summary: Character that is used to replace empty (not filled) positions in the while building string returned by the and properties.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the Space character.
This property is designed for situation when empty position characters expected by application (database) would be confusing if used as prompts. For example '?' or '0' characters.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.DataMode
member.summary: Specifies rules that are used to get/set the property.

remarks.p:
Those rules define various combinations of the following conditions:
Whether or not the literal characters (not editable part of mask) should be included.
Whether or not the required empty mask positions should be included.
Whether or not the optional empty mask positions should be included.
Default value is set to 'RawTextWithRequiredPrompts'. This property is designed to be used when this editor is embedded into grid or other control.

Note: When literal characters are included and the value is set, then characters in that new value which positions match with the positions of the literal characters in mask are ignored. Though, those "dummy" characters should be present in the value, otherwise, the "data" characters will be lost and may appear shifted to wrong positions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.DisplayMode
member.summary: Specifies what should be displayed when control has no focus and has no data.
